registers.name: BOOT_CFG
registers.description: Boot Configuration

bitfields.name: BOOT_SRC
bitfields.description: Primary boot source

values.name: SECONDARY_BOOTLOADER
values.description: Secondary Boot loader in Bank1 IFR0 (32KB)

bitfields.name: ISP_BOOT_IF
bitfields.description: ISP boot interface

bitfields.name: REC_BOOT_SRC
bitfields.description: Recovery boot source

values.name: SB3_IMAGE
values.description: SB3 image in 1-bit SPI flash connected to FlexComm. FC7 used for this function by default overlaps with FlexSPI A.

bitfields.name: BOOT_SPEED
bitfields.description: Core Clock

bitfields.name: HEADER
bitfields.description: CMPA Header marker should be set to 0x5963. After this header is set, all non-zero values will take effect; leaving all settings at 0xff will cause undefined behavior. It is recommended to set all values to 0x00 before setting the CMPA header value.

registers.name: FLASH_CFG
registers.description: Flash Configuration

bitfields.name: FLASH_REMAP_SIZE
bitfields.description:
Flash remap size. 
FLASH_REMAP_SIZE defines the size of the secondary boot image 
(the range of flash addresses that will be remapped)in internal flash, where remapped 
address end = (FLASH_REMAP_SIZE + 1) * 32 KB. For example, if FLASH_REMAP_SIZE = 2, 
then the first 96KB of addresses will be remapped to flash bank1 instead of flash bank0 
when remap is active. Set this field to 0 if you do not want to use the flash remap feature.

bitfields.name: OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT
bitfields.description:
Defines protection for Bank1_IFR0 area based on usage. 
Note, if the SBL / Recovery image size is more than IFR0 size of 32KB then sectors from users flash can be associated for extended image size using CMPA.REC_IMG_EXT0/1.

values.name: OEM_ROM_RWXL_CODE
values.description: Not determined by ROM (MBC fields are modified by OEM code)

values.name: OEM_ROOT_RWXL_1010
values.description: Used as OEM Root of Trust image, in other words secondary boot loader (OEM_SBL). MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1010. Updatable by OEM code later.

values.name: OEM_SBL_RWXL_1011
values.description: Used as OEM_SBL. MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 1011.

values.name: OEM_SBL_RWXL_0011
values.description: Used as OEM_SBL. MBC protection bits set as RWXL = 0011.

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_1010
values.description: Used as OEM recovery boot image with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to  RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to user image.

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_1011
values.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to  RWXL = 1011 on ROM exiting to user image.

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_0011
values.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to  RWXL = 0011 on ROM exiting to user image.

values.name: OEM_REC_RWXL_0001
values.description: Used as OEM_RCVRY_IMG with MBC protection RWXL = 1010 on ROM exiting to recovery image. But set to  RWXL = 0001 on ROM exiting to user image.

bitfields.name: ISP_PIN_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through pin assertion.

bitfields.name: ISP_DM_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through debug mailbox command.

bitfields.name: ISP_API_ENTRY
bitfields.description:
Disable ISP mode entry through ROM API call. 
ISP mode can be entered through ROM API invocation

bitfields.name: ISP_FT_ENTRY
bitfields.description: Disable ISP mode entry through image authentication failure

registers.name: BOOT_LED_STATUS
registers.description: Boot LED Status

bitfields.name: REC_BOOT_LED
bitfields.description:
Assert on recovery boot. 
ROM drives the GPIO pin high, identified by this field whenever primary boot fails and fall through to recovery boot source. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. 
[7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4  ports are allowed. 
If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00.

bitfields.name: ISP_BOOT_LED
bitfields.description:
Assert on ISP fall through. 
ROM drives the GPIO pin high identified by this field whenever primary boot fails and execution falls through to ISP mode. 
[[4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. 
[7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4  ports are allowed. 
If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00.

bitfields.name: BOOT_FAIL_LED
bitfields.description:
Assert on fatal errors during boot. 
ROM drives the GPIO pin high identified by this field whenever primary boot fails due to fatal errors before locking-up/reset. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number. P0_0 and P0_1 are not supported. 
[7:5] GPIO port number. Only 0 - 4  ports are allowed. 
If this feature is not use then set this field to 0x00.

registers.name: BOOT_TIMERS
registers.description: Boot Timers

bitfields.name: POWERDOWN_TIMEOUT_SECS
bitfields.description:
Power down timeout. 
ISP mode peripheral detection timeout value in seconds. 
If a non-zero value is program and peripheral activity is not detected within the number of seconds specified here, then the device will go to power down mode to conserve power.

bitfields.name: WDOG_TIMEOUT_COUNT
bitfields.description:
WDOG timeout. 
Upper 16 bits of 24-bit count value in WWDT0_TC register Timeout value in seconds. The lower 8 bits of  WWDT0_TC are set to 0. 
When a non-zero value is programmed in this field ROM configures the watch dog timer to reset the device on timeout before passing execution control to user code.

registers.name: FLEXSPI_BOOT_CFG0
registers.description: FlexSPI Boot Configuration 0

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN
bitfields.description: Quad/Octal-SPI flash auto probe feature enable

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PROBE_TYPE
bitfields.description:
Quad/Octal-SPI flash probe type. 
Note, this field is used when FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN is set.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FLASH_TYPE
bitfields.description:
Define typical Serial NOR Flash types. 
This field is always used irrespective of FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN value.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DUMMY_CYCLES
bitfields.description:
Quad/Octal-SPI dummy cycles for read command. 
If a non-zero value is programmed in this field, then the value is used to override the default number of dummy cycles for a fast read command read from the serial flash's SFDP information. 
Note: this field is only used if FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN is set.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_FREQUENCY
bitfields.description:
Quad/Octal-SPI flash interface frequency. 
Note, this field is used when FLEXSPI_AUTO_PROBE_EN is set.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE
bitfields.description: Use O/QSPI_RESET_PIN to reset the flash device.

values.name: NO_RESET
values.description: NO_RESET(O/QSPI device reset pin is not connected or available

values.name: EN_RESET
values.description: EN_RESET(O/QSPI device reset pin is connected to a GPIO (QSPI_RESET_PIN)

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_GPIO_PORT
bitfields.description: When FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE = 1, this field determines the GPIO  port number to use for O/QSPI reset function.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_RESET_GPIO_PIN
bitfields.description: When FLEXSPI_RESET_ENABLE = 1, this field determines the GPIO  pin number to use for O/QSPI reset function.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description:
Delay after reset before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices. 
Note, for POR in addition to this wait time FLEXSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME is added.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_PWR_HOLD_TIME
bitfields.description: Delay after POR before accessing Quad/Octal-SPI flash devices in addition to delay defined by FLEXSPI_HOLD TIME field.

bitfields.name: PORT_SEL
bitfields.description: Defined which FlexSPI portA/B is used for boot.

registers.name: FLEXSPI_BOOT_CFG1
registers.description: FlexSPI Boot Configuration 1

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_DELAY_CELL_NUM
bitfields.description:
Delay cell numbers for Flash read sampling via DQS (either internal loopback or external DQS). 
The value provided here is loaded into the FLEXSPIn_DLLnCR.

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET
bitfields.description:
Any offset in memory mapped FlexSPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support  eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. 
This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. 
 
FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of the second image. FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped. 
If this field is left blank boot ROM will not enable FlexSPI remap feature. 
 
The physical flash offset is computed as below: 
 
physical offset = FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET * 256KByte;

bitfields.name: FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE
bitfields.description:
Any offset in memory mapped FlexSPI Flash area could be remapped to offset zero to support eXecute In Place (XIP) of image programmed at different offset. This allows to build all update images with same RO base address, which are programmed at offset 0 or higher offset. FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET field specifies the offset location of second image. FLEXSPI_REMAP_IMAGE_SIZE field specifies the size multiple to determine the size of area to be remapped. 
NOTE: FlexSPI remap size cannot exceed the start address of boot image 1.

values.name: SIZE_OFFSET
values.description: Remap size = FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET * 256KByte; ''  SIZE_OFFSET ''Size of the remapped area (aka second half) is same as first half. It is determined by FLEXSPI_IMAGE_OFFSET Field.

registers.name: REC_SPI_FLASH_CFG0
registers.description: Recovery SPI Flash Configuration 0

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_SCK_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default SPI_SCK ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SCK pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_SCK_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by REC_SPI_SCK_PIN.

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_FLEXCOM
bitfields.description: Identifies the FlexComm used for SPI ISP mode.

[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: REC_SPI_SSEL_PIN

SPI chip select number. 
FlexComm SPI interfaces supports up to four chip selects.

bitfields.name: REC_BOOT_PIN_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined pins for 1-bit SPI recovery boot pins.

bitfields.name: I2C_ISP_FLEXCOM

Override default I2C SDA ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as I2C_SDA pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number

registers.name: ISP_CAN_CFG
registers.description: ISP CAN Configuration

bitfields.name: CAN_RX_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default CAN RX ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as CAN_RX pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: CAN_RX_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by CAN_RX_PIN.

bitfields.name: CAN_ISP_INST
bitfields.description:
Identifies the instance used for CAN ISP mode. 
0: For CAN0. 
1: For CAN1. 
Others: Reserved.

bitfields.name: CAN_TX_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default CAN TX ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as CAN_TX pin. 
[7:5] GPIO port number 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number

bitfields.name: CAN_TX_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by CAN_TX_PIN.

bitfields.name: CAN_BAUD_RATE
bitfields.description:
CAN baud rate. 
Baud rate configured during CAN ISP mode. 
2b'0000: Auto baud detection (125K, 250K, 500K, 750K, 1M). 
2b'0101 and above: 1000 kbps and auto baud detection.

registers.name: ISP_SPI_CFG0
registers.description: ISP SPI Configuration 0

bitfields.name: SPI_SCK_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default SPI_SCK ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_SCK pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: SPI_SCK_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by SPI_SCK_PIN.

bitfields.name: SPI_ISP_FLEXCOM
bitfields.description: Identifies the FlexComm used for SPI ISP mode.

bitfields.name: SPI_MOSI_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default SPI_MOSI ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as SPI_MOSI pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: SPI_MOSI_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by SPI_MOSI_PIN.

bitfields.description:
Override default SPI_MISO ISP pin.

[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: SPI_MISO_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by SPI_MISO_PIN.

bitfields.name: SPI_SSEL_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default SPI_SSEL ISP pin.

[4:0] GPIO Pin number

SPI chip select number.

registers.name: ISP_USB_ID
registers.description: ISP USB Identification

bitfields.name: USB_Vendor_ID
bitfields.description: Customer defined USB vendor ID used during USB-ISP mode device enumeration.

bitfields.name: USB_Product_ID
bitfields.description: Customer defined USB product ID used during USB-ISP mode device enumeration.

registers.name: ISP_USB_CFG
registers.description: ISP USB Configuration

bitfields.name: USB0_VBUS_PIN
bitfields.description:
Override default USBx_VBUS_DETECT ISP pin. 
Identifies the pin to be used as USBx_VBUS detect pin. 
[4:0] GPIO Pin number 
[7:5] GPIO port number

bitfields.name: USB0_VBUS_FUNC_SLOT
bitfields.description: Identifies the ALT pin mux function to use for the pin selected by USBx_VBUS_PIN.

bitfields.name: EXT_XTAL_CLK
bitfields.description:
USB PHY input clock frequency. 
For USB high speed PHY external XTAL input is needed. This field specifies the frequency of XTAL used on board.

values.name: XTAL_16MHZ
values.description: 16MHz input clock (Divide by 30) - Default option when CMPA is blank.

bitfields.name: PRE_DIV
bitfields.description:
Enable Pre-divider. 
Needed to support 48MHz and other high speed crystals.

registers.name: ISP_MISC_CFG
registers.description: ISP Miscellaneous Configuration

bitfields.name: I2C_SLAVE_ADDR
bitfields.description:
I2C slave address. 
A 7-bit Address used for selecting our device on shared I2C bus system. 
By default  ROM uses 0x10 as slave address. If this address conflicts with another slave on board  customer could use this field to override the address.

bitfields.name: ISP_USB_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined GPIO for USB VBUS detect function during ISP mode.

values.name: USB0_VBUS
values.description: Customer defined GPIO for USB0_VBUS detect.

values.name: USB1_VBUS
values.description: Customer defined GPIO for USB1_VBUS detect.

values.name: VDD_USB
values.description: Use VDD_USB for VBUS presence. On board regulator should generate VDD_USB voltage using 5V input fo VBUS pin on connector.

bitfields.name: ISP_CAN_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined CAN ISP pins.

bitfields.name: ISP_SPI_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined SPI ISP pins.

bitfields.name: ISP_I2C_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined I2C ISP pins.

bitfields.name: ISP_UART_CUST
bitfields.description: Use customer defined UART ISP pins.

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_PIN
registers.description: Credential Constraints for SoC specific Use Pinned

bitfields.name: NIDEN
bitfields.description: Non-secure Non-invasive Debug Enable

bitfields.name: DBGEN
bitfields.description: Non-secure Debug Enable

bitfields.name: SPNIDEN
bitfields.description: Secure Non-invasive Debug Enable

bitfields.name: SPIDEN
bitfields.description: Secure Invasive Debug Enable

bitfields.name: DSP_DBGEN
bitfields.description: DSP Debug Enable

bitfields.name: ISP_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: ISP Boot Command Enable

bitfields.name: FA_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: FA Command Enable

bitfields.name: ME_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: Flash Mass Erase Command Enable

bitfields.name: CPU1_NIDEN
bitfields.description: Second CM33 Non-invasive Debug Enable

bitfields.name: CPU1_DBGEN
bitfields.description: Second CM33 Debug Enable

bitfields.name: UUID_CHECK
bitfields.description: Enforce UUID match during Debug authentication.

values.name: DISABLED
values.description: Debug certificate can be used with all devices.

values.name: ENABLED
values.description: Debug certificate per device with matching UUID is needed.

bitfields.name: INVERSE_VALUE
bitfields.description: Inverse Value

registers.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_DFLT
registers.description: Credential Constraints for SoC specific Use Debug Filter

bitfields.name: NIDEN
bitfields.description: Non Secure Non-invasive Debug Fixed State

bitfields.name: DBGEN
bitfields.description: Non-secure Debug Fixed State

bitfields.name: SPNIDEN
bitfields.description: Secure Non-invasive Debug Fixed State

bitfields.name: SPIDEN
bitfields.description: Secure Invasive Debug Fixed State

bitfields.name: DSP_DBGEN
bitfields.description: DSP Debug Fixed State

bitfields.name: ISP_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: ISP Command Fixed State

bitfields.name: FA_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: FA Command Fixed State

bitfields.name: ME_CMD_EN
bitfields.description: Flash Mass Erase Command Fixed State

bitfields.name: CPU1_NIDEN
bitfields.description: Second CM33 Non-Invasive Debug Fixed State

bitfields.name: CPU1_DBGEN
bitfields.description: Second CM33 Debug Fixed State

bitfields.name: INVERSE_VALUE
bitfields.description: Inverse Value

registers.name: VENDOR_USAGE
registers.description: Vendor Usage

bitfields.name: VENDOR_USAGE
bitfields.description:
Vendor Usage [31:16]. 
Upper 16 bits of vendor usage field defined in DAP. Lower 16-bits come from customer field area (CFPA.DBG_REVOKE_VU).

registers.name: Reserved 0x0004C
registers.description: This field is reserved for internal use

registers.name: SECURE_BOOT_CFG
registers.description: Secure Boot Configuration

bitfields.name: SEC_BOOT_EN
bitfields.description:
Secure boot enforcement. 
This field defines the minimum image verification procedure (CRC32, CMAC, ECDSA sign). 
The Image type field in header indicates the type of verification data (checksum or signature) included in it. 
Note: Plain < CRC32 < CMAC < ECDSA

values.name: CRC32_IMAGES
values.description: Only CRC32 or signed (CMAC or ECDSA) images are allowed.

values.name: SIGNED_IMAGES
values.description: Only Signed (CMAC or ECDSA) images are allowed.

values.name: ECDSA_SIGNED
values.description: Only ECDSA signed images are allowed.

bitfields.name: LP_SEC_BOOT
bitfields.description: Secure boot option for low-power wake from power-down and deep-powerdown. For CFPA/CMPA do CRC check always.

values.name: CHECK_CRC32
values.description: CRC check for PFR and CRC32 check of active image

values.name: CHECK_JUMP
values.description: CRC check for PFR and jump to vector address specified in CFPA.

values.name: CMAC_CHECK
values.description: CRC check for PFR and CMAC check of active image

bitfields.name: ENF_CNSA
bitfields.description:
Enforce CNSA suite approved algorithms for secure boot, secure update and debug authentication. 
Note, CMAC image authentication is only allowed in 2b'00 setting.

values.name: LIMITED_0b01
values.description: Only ECC P-384 keys, SHA384 and AES256 algorithms are used.

values.name: LIMITED_0b10
values.description: Only ECC P-384 keys, SHA384 and AES256 algorithms are used.

values.name: LIMITED_0b11
values.description: Only ECC P-384 keys, SHA384 and AES256 algorithms are used.

bitfields.name: ENF_TZM_PRESET
bitfields.description: Enforce TrustZone-M mode.

values.name: ENFORCE_0b01
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

values.name: ENFORCE_0b10
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

values.name: ENFORCE_0b11
values.description: Enforce preset TZM data in image manifest.

bitfields.name: ITRC_ZEROIZE
bitfields.description:
RAM zeroize on ITRC event. 
Zeroize long-term storage RAM (RAMA) on subsequent boot when Intrusion and Tamper control signals an intrusion event (ITRC_OUT3). 
Note, when ITRC is re-configured in application then ITRC_OUT4 (CHIP_RESET) should be triggered with at least same events as ITRC_OUT3 (RAM_ZEROIZE).

values.name: PKC_RAM_ON_ITRC
values.description: Always Zeroize PKC RAM on ITRC event only.

values.name: PKC_RAMA_ON_ITRC
values.description: Zeroize PKC and RAMA on ITRC event only.

values.name: PKC_RAMA_ALL_RESET
values.description: Always Zeroize PKC and RAMA on all reset boot.

bitfields.name: ACTIVE_IMG_PROT
bitfields.description:
Protection of active image. 
This field defines protection of flash area occupied by the active image. Only applicable to internal flash.

values.name: FLASH_ACL_PROTECTION
values.description: Protection is defined using the CFPA FLASH_ACL settings.

values.name: WITH_STICKY_LOCK
values.description: Write protect active image area with sticky lock. GLBAC2 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored.

values.name: NO_STICKY_LOCK
values.description: Write protect active image area without sticky lock. GLBAC4 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored.

values.name: XOM_PROTECTION
values.description: XOM protect active image area with sticky lock. GLBAC6 is used. FLASH_ACL settings are ignored.

bitfields.name: FIPS_SHA_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for SHA2 block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero  run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

values.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER
values.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bitfields.name: FIPS_AES_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for AES block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero  run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

values.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER
values.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bitfields.name: FIPS_ECDSA_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for ECDSA block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero  run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

values.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER
values.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bitfields.name: FIPS_DRBG_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for DRBG block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero  run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

values.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER
values.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bitfields.name: FIPS_CMAC_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for CMAC block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero  run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

values.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER
values.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bitfields.name: FIPS_KDF_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for KDF block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero  run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

values.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER
values.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bitfields.name: FIPS_PUF_STEN
bitfields.description: Enable self-test for PUF block on power-up. Needed for FIPS certification. If this field is non-zero  run self-test and log result in SYSCON->ELS_AS_BOOT_LOG1[FIPS].

values.name: FAILURE_ISP
values.description: On failure enter ISP mode for recovery.

values.name: FAILURE_ENF_POWER
values.description: On failure lock the device to enforce power-cycle.

bitfields.name: SKIP_DICE
bitfields.description: Skip DICE computation.

bitfields.name: DICE_INC_NXP_CFG
bitfields.description: Include NXP area (IFR1) containing specific part configuration data defined during chip manufacturing process in DICE computation.

bitfields.name: DICE_INC_CUST_CFG
bitfields.description: Include data from CMPA page (512 bytes) in DICE computation.

bitfields.name: REG0_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description:
Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 0. 
When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. 
When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 
 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 
 1x - ROM API will perform erase check.

bitfields.name: REG1_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description:
Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 1. 
When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. 
When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 
 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 
 1x - ROM API will perform erase check.

bitfields.name: REG2_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description:
Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 2. 
When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. 
When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 
 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 
 1x - ROM API will perform erase check.

bitfields.name: REG3_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bitfields.description:
Enable erase check for NPX PRINCE context 3. 
When erase check is enabled ROM API will enforce a check to guarantee that all sectors selected in the context are erased together. 
When erase check is enabled only contiguous sectors can be selected in context bitmap. 
 0x - ROM API will not perform erase check. 
 1x - ROM API will perform erase check.

bitfields.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX0
bitfields.description:
Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 0 settings. 
Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG0_ERASE_CHECK_EN field.

bitfields.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX1
bitfields.description:
Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 1 settings. 
Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG1_ERASE_CHECK_EN field.

bitfields.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX2
bitfields.description:
Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 2 settings. 
Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG2_ERASE_CHECK_EN field.

bitfields.name: NPX_LOCK_CTX3
bitfields.description:
Lock on-chip flash NPX PRINCE context 3 settings. 
Note: when locking a region recommendation is to also enable erase checking using the REG3_ERASE_CHECK_EN field.

registers.name: NPX_CTX0_WD0
registers.description:
Bitmap mask for NPX Prince context 0 (sectors 0 - 31). 
ROM copies this value to NPX->VMAPCTX0_WD0 register during flash initialization. This bitmask indicates which 32KB block is encrypted/decrypted using CTX0 key and IV.

registers.name: NPX_CTX0_WD1
registers.description:
Bitmap mask for NPX Prince context 0 (sectors 32 - 63). 
ROM copies this value to NPX->VMAPCTX0_WD1 register during flash initialization. This bitmask indicates which 32KB block is encrypted/decrypted using CTX0 key and IV.

registers.name: NPX_CTX1_WD0

registers.name: REC_IMG_EXT0
registers.description:
Bitmap mask to indicate sectors included in recovery image (sectors 8 - 31).
Recovery image is programmed in BANK1_IFR0. But if the image size is more than 32KB, this field can be used to indicate sectors to include in recovery image.
ROM will configure flash protection setting for these sectors the same as BANK1_IFR0 before exiting to user code. 
The protection settings are managed through CMPA.OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT. The lower 8 sectors are excluded from this mask to avoid conflicts with dual image boot feature.

bitfields.name: REC_IMG_EXT0
bitfields.description: Bitmap mask to indicate sectors included in recovery image.

registers.name: REC_IMG_EXT1
registers.description:
Bitmap mask to indicate sectors included in recovery image (sectors 40 - 63).
Recovery image is programmed in BANK1_IFR0. But if the image size is more than 32KB, this field can be used to indicate sectors to include in recovery image.
ROM will configure flash protection setting for these sectors the same as BANK1_IFR0 before exiting to user code. 
The protection settings are managed through CMPA.OEM_BANK1_IFR0_PROT. The lower 8 sectors are excluded from this mask to avoid conflicts with dual image boot feature.

bitfields.name: REC_IMG_EXT1
bitfields.description: Bitmap mask to indicate sectors included in recovery image.

registers.name: QUICK_SET_GPIO_0
registers.description:
Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins high after reset. 
Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. 
This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot. 
Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_0 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

registers.name: QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0
registers.description:
Drive GPIO 0 port [31:0] pins low. 
Each bit corresponds to the pin in GPIO port 0. When set ROM drives the corresponding pin high as soon as possible. By default most pins come-up as tri-stated inputs. 
This feature allows customer to specify active drive pins soon after reset instead of waiting till complete boot. 
Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_0 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_0 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

Note, if a pin is selected in both QUICK_SET_GPIO_1 and QUICK_CLR_GPIO_1 fields then pin will be set to high-level with quick transition to low.

registers.name: CMPA_CRC32
registers.description: CRC32 of CMPA page data from offset 0x00 to 0x1EB. ROM updates this field along with CMPA_CMAC. ROM uses this field based on CMPA.LP_SEC_BOOT field option.

registers.name: CMPA_CMAC0
registers.description: CMAC[31:0] of CMPA page data from offset 0x00 to 0x1EB. ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.

registers.name: CMPA_CMAC1
registers.description: CMAC[63:32] of CMPA page data from offset 0x00 to 0x1EB. ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.

registers.name: CMPA_CMAC2
registers.description: CMAC[95:64] of CMPA page data from offset 0x00 to 0x1EB. ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.

registers.name: CMPA_CMAC3
registers.description: CMAC[127:96] of CMPA page data from offset 0x00 to 0x1EB. ROM updates this field on subsequent boot after page update.
